;
;;小罗伯特·F·肯尼迪周一在费城独立购物中心举行的竞选活动中发表讲话。
;

;罗伯特肯尼迪政治家族的后裔小 F 肯尼迪 (F Kennedy Jr) 在过去六个月中一直在竞选 2024 年民主党总统提名，周一宣布他将继续以独立人士身份入主白宫。

; <这位69岁的阴谋论者和疫苗接种反对者在费城发表了激烈的演讲，宣布他“独立于民主党和所有其他政党”，并向数百名支持者讲述了他离开美国的“痛苦”他的叔叔兼父亲约翰·F·肯尼迪和罗伯特·F·肯尼迪所在的政党。

;

;“我来这里是为了宣布自己是美国总统的独立候选人。我来这里是为了和你们一起为我们整个国家发表新的独立宣言。”他说，“两党建制”正在“带领我们走向悬崖”。

;
;

;;相关：;;马特·盖茨表示，驱逐凯文·麦卡锡值得冒失去席位的风险;;

;

;“不满情绪的高涨正在席卷我们的国家。这种不满情绪存在危险，但也存在机会和希望，”他补充道，这似乎是指共和党领先候选人唐纳德·特朗普。

;

;“我们似乎正在从绝望转向愤怒。然后又回到绝望。这个国家已经准备好迎接历史性的改变。他们已经准备好收回他们的自由、他们的独立了。”

;

;然而，发布会却出了点问题，肯尼迪在被介绍后就短暂离开了舞台，抱怨他在自动提示器上看不到他的演讲。 ，然后努力寻找自己的步伐。

;

;他的竞选活动立即被批评为对美国“危险”;全国民主党人的平均支持率为 15%;。其他;民意调查显示;他在共和党人中比在民主党支持者中更受欢迎。

;

;尽管他赢得选举的机会几乎不存在，但他的候选资格仍然可能扮演重要的搅局者角色。 ;分析师对于肯尼迪是否当选存在分歧;以独立人士身份参选会对共和党或民主党造成更大伤害。

;

;“民主党人害怕我会破坏拜登总统的选举，而共和党人则害怕我会破坏总统的选举。”特朗普，”他说。 “事实是，他们都是对的。我的目的是破坏他们俩的生活。”

;

;在过去的六个月里，肯尼迪，他;有着宣扬阴谋论的记录;以及长期反对疫苗的历史，一直在努力争取拜登的支持。< /p>;

;约翰·F·肯尼迪 (John F Kennedy) 的侄子和罗伯特·F·肯尼迪 (Robert F Kennedy) 的儿子都是被暗杀的民主党人，他因有关 wifi 导致“大脑漏水”和 ;水中化学物质;导致性别烦躁不安。

;

;7 月，他在 ;他声称;针对Covid的目的是为了使德系犹太人和中国人免受该疾病的最严重影响；同月，政治监督机构国会诚信项目发布了一份报告 ;详细介绍了肯尼迪;与种族主义者、反犹太主义者和极端主义阴谋论者的会面和宣传。

;

;自发起竞选活动以来，肯尼迪多次出现在右翼新闻频道福克斯新闻上，并且还出现在前特朗普顾问史蒂夫·班农和右翼阴谋论者亚历克斯·琼斯的播客中。

;

;肯尼迪在费城由一众演讲者介绍，其中包括他的妻子、演员谢丽尔·海因斯和他的竞选经理丹尼斯·库西尼奇 (Dennis Kucinich)，他是 1997 年至 2013 年俄亥俄州的民主党国会议员。

;

;另一位发言者是南达科他州下布鲁尔苏族部落的长老刘易斯·格拉斯罗普 (Lewis Grassrope)，他说他正在利用土著人民日呼吁弥合政治分歧。 “左翼和右翼总是在战斗。如果他们总是打架，我们怎么能成为一体呢？”他在用美国本土语言进行祈祷之前说道。

;

;周一的声明也在 YouTube 上进行了现场直播，最多时只有 23,000 名观众观看。

;

;共和党人立即尝试他们与肯尼迪保持距离，在一份谈话要点备忘录中坚称“小罗伯特·肯尼迪和典型的民主党政客之间几乎没有什么交集”。

;

;共和党全国委员会 (RNC) 的备忘录列出了支持共和党选民的 23 条理由拒绝他，包括肯尼迪之前对民主党总统候选人巴拉克·奥巴马和希拉里·克林顿的支持，以及对民主党在气候紧急情况、经济和堕胎问题上立场的支持。

;

;“小罗伯特·肯尼迪完全知道他会< a href="https://twitter.com/theblaze/status/1708870582865928219">;“从共和党候选人那里获得更多选票;”；这就是他参选的原因，”共和党全国委员会的备忘录说道。

;;2012 年，阿富汗赫尔曼德省的一名英国士兵。
;

;英国 SAS 面临以下指控： 2010 年至 2013 年期间，即对阿富汗 80 名平民被杀事件进行公开调查的第一天，它在 9 名阿富汗人熟睡时开枪打死，并实施了“处决处于战斗年龄的阿富汗男性”的政策。

; < p>;调查律师奥利弗·格拉斯哥·KC (Oliver Glasgow KC) 重点关注了阿富汗南部赫尔曼德省的七起致命行动，其中包括 2011 年 2 月的一次行动，在九人被杀后，只找到了三支 AK47 突击步枪。

;

;“这次调查的核心指控是赤裸裸的，”格拉斯哥告诉高等法院。旨在针对塔利班指挥官的家庭大院袭击“遭到英国特种部队内部人员的滥用”。

;

;他们“执行了一项政策，在不构成直接威胁的情况下处决达到战斗年龄的阿富汗男性”或;失去战斗能力;[无法履行战斗职责]，”在他们很脆弱或据说突然拿出枪或手榴弹的情况下。

;

;公共调查由主席主持预计需要 12 至 18 个月的时间才能完成中期报告。这标志着受害者长期以来寻求的一个程序的开始，但只有在两个家庭将英国政府告上法庭后，保守党部长才批准了这一程序。

;

;调查所施加的保密条件意味着调查的大部分内容将被扣押在没有公众或媒体在场的情况下进行——并且所有参与其中的士兵的身份以及他们的指挥官和 SAS 其他成员以及英国军队中许多其他成员的姓名都已被编辑。

;

;也国防部或调查是否会正式承认 SAS 参与阿富汗事务，尽管此事已被广泛报道，但将参与其中的人员描述为英国特种部队成员。

;

;格拉斯哥还强调了出现的电子邮件表明我们正在努力掩盖担忧，并且某些方面对有关死亡事件数量不断增加的内部报告不可信表示怀疑。

;

;SAS 的一名法律官员在 2011 年 2 月表示，他他对“最近发生的一系列高级 EKIA（在行动中被杀的敌人）事件感到担忧”，并表示：“我感觉我们编写这些内容的方式在未来几年内不会经受住审查”，并补充说，这些内容将被

;

;格拉斯哥描述的致命事件包括：

;
    ;
  • ;

    ;2011 年 2 月 7 日的一次夜间突袭，当时有 9 名阿富汗男性，包括一名 14 岁男孩被杀，并起获三支 AK47 突击步枪。格拉斯哥说：“我们预计来自家人的证据将表明他们是在床上被枪杀的，很可能是在睡着时被枪杀的。”他告诉调查组，尸体的照片表明阿富汗人可能是在近距离被枪杀的。调查获得的内部文件和电子邮件显示，特别空勤团表示，当时其士兵遭到轻武器射击。该精锐部队总部的结论是，无需宪兵调查，因为“根据自卫法使用了合理武力”。

    ;
    • ;

    ;2011 年 2 月 9 日的一次夜间突袭特种空勤团表示，八名阿富汗人被杀，其中四人被己方友军炮火打死。突袭结束后，在对现场的搜查中发现了四把 AK-47，而另一名男子在被送回大楼时被杀，但他带着武器再次出现。第二天早上，SAS 总部的一位参谋长向一位法律同事发送了一封电子邮件，格拉斯哥宣读了一封电子邮件，在他们审查初步报告时表达了怀疑。 “这是‘尸体多于武器’的另一种情况。请审查，”他们写道。然而，两天后，同一位参谋长承认“大量死亡”是合理的，因为四名阿富汗人因“自相残杀”而被杀。格拉斯哥说，几年后，宪兵对这一事件进行了调查，但当涉及的 SAS 和阿富汗武装部队成员接受询问时，“除了其中一人之外，所有人都无法回忆起”那次枪战。

    ;

; Tue, 10 Oct 2023 03:22:01 +0800 X criticised for enabling spread of Israel-Hamas disinformationhttps://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/oct/09/x-twitter-elon-musk-disinformation-israel-hamas
;;2023-10-09T17:57:14Z;
;
;;Elon Musk 紧握双手。
;

;X 对 ;以色列与哈马斯冲突;在“大量”虚假帖子以及埃隆·马斯克推荐发表虚假声明或反犹太主义言论的帐户进行战争报道后，该帐户受到了审查。

;

;X（前 Twitter）的所有者周日推荐了两个帐户。他写道：“对于实时跟踪战争，@WarMonitors 和 @sentdefender 非常好。还值得关注实地的直接消息来源。请在下面的回复中添加有趣的选项。”

;

;@WarMonitors 帐户在 6 月份告诉一名用户“去崇拜犹太人小兄弟”，而这两个帐户在 5 月份都帮助传播了发生爆炸的虚假声明在五角大楼。大西洋理事会数字取证研究实验室的研究员艾默生·T·布鲁金 (Emerson T Brooking) 表示，@sentdefender 帐户经常发布“错误且无法核实的内容”。

;

;马斯克此后删除了自己的帖子，并对描述加沙的战争监视器帖子提出异议战士被称为“烈士”。他写道：“虽然报道双方都是公平的，但请使用尽可能准确的词语，否则我必须撤回我关注你的帐户的建议。”

;

;虚假的社交媒体帐户正在传播有关以色列与哈马斯冲突的虚假信息，据虚假信息专家称，受影响的平台包括 X 和 TikTok。

;

;据以色列分析公司 Cyabra 称，参与有关哈马斯袭击及其后果的在线对话的社交媒体帐户中有五分之一是假的。

;

;Cyabra 一直监控美国选举虚假信息并跟踪 Twitter 上的机器人帐户，发现大约 30,000 个虚假帐户一直在传播支持哈马斯的虚假信息或收集有关其目标的敏感细节。

;

;该公司表示，这些虚假账户（其中许多是非人手操作的自动化机器人账户）在 X 和 TikTok 上特别活跃，但也出现在其他平台上。

;

;该公司旗下 BBC verify 的一名记者事实核查和虚假信息部门表示，自袭击发生以来，X 上出现了“大量”虚假帖子，其中包括来自冒充 BBC 记者的账户的帖子。

;

;Shayan Sardarizadeh 在 X 上发布了经过验证的不真实帖子支付蓝色勾号的账户在整个平台上得到了提升。他表示，X 的众包事实核查功能（社区注释）无法应对虚假帖子的数量。

;

;“我多年来一直在 Twitter 上进行事实核查，在重大事件期间总是存在大量错误信息。事件。但过去两天大量的虚假帖子（其中许多是通过 Twitter Blue [现在的 X Premium] 传播的）是另一回事。事实核查人员和社区注释都无法跟上这一点。”

; ;

;一个模仿《耶路撒冷邮报》的账户，自被暂停以来，发布了虚假声明X 上，以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡已被送往医院，而来自叙利亚的镜头;被错误标记; 来自加沙。

;

;已联系 X 和 TikTok 征求意见。

; Tue, 10 Oct 2023 02:22:01 +0800 Coldplay and former manager sue each other for millionshttps://www.theguardian.com/music/2023/oct/09/coldplay-and-former-manager-sue-each-other-for-millions

;酷玩乐队与他们的前任经理陷入了一场法律纠纷，双方都双方向高等法院提出相互竞争的索赔，要求对方支付数百万英镑。

;

;2005 年至 2022 年期间管理酷玩乐队的戴夫·霍姆斯 (Dave Holmes) 在 8 月份起诉该集团，要求其支付 1000 万英镑的“未付佣金”，他声称自己是欠的。他说这笔钱与两张尚未发行的专辑有关，他声称自己与该乐队合作制作了这些专辑。

;

;但在新的反诉讼中，乐队拒绝了 Holmes 的索赔，并寻求 1400 万英镑的赔偿。他们表示，他们的前任经理允许巡演成本滚雪球般增加，同时还声称他利用与乐队的关系从音乐会主办方 Live Nation 处获得了总计 3000 万美元（2460 万英镑）的贷款。

;

; Tue, 10 Oct 2023 00:22:02 +0800 Goalkeepers perceive the world differently, study suggestshttps://www.theguardian.com/science/2023/oct/09/goalkeepers-perceive-world-differently-says-study-football
;;2023-10-09T15:00:13Z;
;
;;阿斯顿维拉门将埃米利亚诺·马丁内斯
;

;前英超门将布拉德·弗里德尔曾经说过要想在禁区内表现出色，就必须能够跳出禁区思考。

;

;现在，科学数据支持这样的观点：守门员的大脑确实以不同的方式感知世界 - 他们的大脑似乎能够合并信号from the different senses more quickly, possibly underpinning their unique abilities on the football pitch.

;

;Goalkeeping is the ;most specialised position in football;, with the primary objective of stopping the opposition from scoring. But while previous studies have highlighted differences in physiological and performance profiles between goalkeepers and other players, far less was known about whether they have different perceptual or cognitive abilities.

;

;“Unlike other football players, goalkeepers are required to make thousands of very fast decisions based on limited or incomplete sensory information,” said Michael Quinn, a former goalkeeper in the Irish Premiership, who is now studying for a master's degree in behavioural neuroscience at University College Dublin.

;

;Suspecting that this ability might hinge on an enhanced capacity to combine information from different senses, Quinn and researchers at Dublin City University and University College Dublin recruited 60 professional goalkeepers, outfield players and age-matched non-players to do a series of tests, looking for differences in their ability to distinguish sounds and flashes as separate from one another. Doing so enabled them to estimate volunteers' temporal binding windows – the timeframe in which different sensory signals are fused together in the brain.

;

;The study, published in ;Current Biology;, found that goalkeepers had a narrower temporal binding window relative to outfielders and non-soccer players, indicating a more precise and speedy estimation of the timing of audiovisual cues.

;

;Goalkeepers also showed a greater tendency to separate out these sensory signals, which may stem from a need to make quick decisions based on visual and auditory information coming in at different times. “For instance, when a player strikes the ball, goalkeepers not only use visual information to determine the ball's direction and flight, but also rely on auditory information such as the sound of the ball being struck. However, the relationship between these cues will change depending on the distance of the striker,” Quinn said. “In other situations – such as where the striker is occluded by other players – goalkeepers may rely more on auditory information than visual information.”

;

;After repeated exposure to those scenarios, goalkeepers may start to process sensory cues separately rather than combining them, he added.

;

;Dr David McGovern, a psychologist at Dublin City University who led the study, said: “While many football players and fans worldwide will be familiar with the idea that goalkeepers are just 'different' from the rest of us, this study may actually be the first time that we have proven scientific evidence to back up this claim.”

;

;It is not yet clear whether these differences stem from the rigorous training regimens of professional goalkeepers, or a natural ability that attracts young players to be goalies. “Further research that tracks the developmental trajectory of aspiring goalkeepers will be required to tease between these possibilities,” said McGovern.

;

;The team hopes to explore further questions, including whether players in other highly specialised positions, such as strikers and centre-backs, also show perceptual differences.

;

;Survivors of a series of powerful earthquakes that struck western Afghanistan on Saturday have spent a second night sleeping amid the rubble of demolished villages as they search for loved ones using shovels, amid a death toll senior Taliban officials have said is approaching 3,000.

;

;In the regional capital of Herat city people slept in public parks and streets, fearing further tremors. The United States Geological Survey (USGS) reported a 4.7-magnitude earthquake on Monday at 2.16pm local time (1046 BST) 19 miles (30km) south-east of the central Qarabagh village in the Gulran district of Herat, and another 4.9-magnitude quake struck the remote area just before noon.

;

;“We have concerns that there may be additional casualties in that area as well,” a Taliban official said. “Our teams are currently en route to provide assistance to those affected regions.”

;

;;Saturday's 6.3-magnitude quake; – followed by eight strong aftershocks – jolted hard-to-reach areas near Herat, toppling rural homes and sending panicked city dwellers into the streets. Afghanistan is already in the grip of a dire humanitarian crisis, with the widespread withdrawal of foreign aid after the ;Taliban's return to power in 2021;.

;

;Rescuers had found a further 350 bodies late on Sunday after officials earlier put the death toll at 2,445 and health workers said they were overwhelmed. “Vans filled with dead bodies are arriving here each minute,” said a medic at Herat hospital. “We are struggling with the very high number of injured people. I have not counted dead bodies. Our morgue is out of capacity.”

;

;The Taliban official said some villages were being reached on Monday for the first time since the quake.

;

;“The rescue operation is still in progress. Forces from the defence ministry arrived in the area this morning and local residents are actively assisting with the operation. There are many people under the rubble and areas we have not reached yet,” he said. “At least 20 villages are completely flattened with people still under the rubble.”

;

;The International Rescue Committee warned the lack of rescue equipment could push up the death toll in western Afghanistan because trapped survivors cannot be freed.

;

;The United Nations migration agency dispatched four ambulances along with doctors and psychosocial support counsellors to the regional hospital. A minimum of three mobile health teams were en route to the Zenda Jan district, one of the hardest-hit areas.

; ;

;The NGO Médecins Sans Frontières set up five medical tents at Herat regional hospital with capacity for up to 80 patients.

;

;Mohammad Javad, from Koshkak village, described the severe impact on the Zenda Jan district.

;

;“The walls crumbled in a mere two seconds, and the entire village was brought to ruins in the same amount of time,” he said from a school accommodating survivors in Herat. “I lost a family member and my neighbours have lost at least four of their loved ones. Out of the over 1,000 people of the village, it's probable that only a quarter of them have managed to survive. It's like a massive grave.”

;

;Another survivor told the Guardian over the phone: “We haven't received any assistance since the earthquake struck. There is nothing left here, with every house in the villages having sustained damage. My husband and I were outside when it happened, and we survived. Many people have lost their lives here.”

;

;;In June 2022,; a powerful earthquake struck a rugged, mountainous region in eastern Afghanistan, flattening stone and mud-brick homes.

;

;“People are in devastating conditions in remote places, they need food, clothes and shelter. They were already very poor people and have nothing left now,” the Taliban official said.

;

;Herat province, home to more than 3 million people on the border with Iran, has been hit by a years-long drought that has crippled many agricultural communities.

;

;The affected area also contains many refugees who have recently returned from Iran and Pakistan, according to the Taliban official.

;

;Aid agencies and NGOs have appealed for help from the international community. Aid from Iran and Pakistan has so far arrived in the area, according to the Taliban.

;

;“With winter approaching, the affected areas will soon experience extremely cold conditions. Many families not only have lost their homes but also their main breadwinners. They are in urgent need of immediate aid and suitable shelters,” said the governor of Herat, Noor Ahmad Islamjar, on Sunday.
